description: Borrowed from Latin corȳza, from Ancient Greek κόρυζα (kóruza, “nasal mucus”).

nouns.description: coryza (countable and uncountable, plural coryzas or coryzae or coryzæ)

entries.meaning: (pathology) Inflammation of the mucous membranes lining the nasal cavity, usually causing a running nose, nasal congestion and loss of smell.
